Ingredients.2: 1 pound fresh morel mushrooms, sliced into 1/2-inch pieces

Ingredients.10: 1 teaspoon chicken bouillon granules, or more to taste

Ingredients.11: 1 teaspoon salt, or more to taste

Ingredients.12: 1 teaspoon cracked black pepper, or more to taste

Directions.1: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Cook mushrooms in butter in batches, turning occasionally, until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Add a portion of the garlic at the end of each batch and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Remove mushroom mixture to a plate.

Directions.2: Add onion to the pot. Cook and stir until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Add mushroom mixture, thyme, and parsley. Pour wine into the pot and cook while scraping the browned bits of food off the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon, about 3 minutes.

Directions.3: Sprinkle flour over the mixture and stir until well incorporated. Add broth, bouillon, salt, and pepper and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, until thickened, about 10 minutes.

Directions.4: Stir in cream and enough milk to reach desired thickness. Cook until heated through.
